article_title: Don’t Let ObamaCare’s Failures Snowball Into Single Payer
article_text: Like an avalanche, the Affordable Care Act has swept through the Rocky Mountain State, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake. At the end of 2013, 335,000 cancellation notices went out to customers whose plans were now deemed illegal by federal regulators. Nearly 200,000 cancellations for the same reason will come at the end of this year. As for Colorado HealthOP, the state’s co-op, which was the largest insurer on the ObamaCare exchange, it shut down in October, leaving more than 80,000 members without coverage. Huge premium increases loom for the remaining exchange plans: an average of 11.7%, according to the...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Nathan Nascimento writes that Coloradans, hit hard by the law, are being pushed toward a state takeover of their health insurance.

article_metadata.author: Nathan Nascimento
article_metadata.article.origheadline: Don’t Let ObamaCare’s Failures Snowball Into Single Payer

article_summary:
Huge premium increases loom for the remaining exchange plans: an average of 11.7%, according to the...
Like an avalanche, the Affordable Care Act has swept through the Rocky Mountain State, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake.
At the end of 2013, 335,000 cancellation notices went out to customers whose plans were now deemed illegal by federal regulators.
Nearly 200,000 cancellations for the same reason will come at the end of this year.
As for Colorado HealthOP, the state’s co-op, which was the largest insurer on the ObamaCare exchange, it shut down in October, leaving more than 80,000 members without coverage.
